inlineContent.text: This protocol is not meant to be conformed to.

abstract.text: The protocol composition that views, layers, guides and nodes
conform to on all generic wrappers, such as Query, Mutator and others.
Perform new item creations on parent item in a
closure if parent item has not yet been displayed
on the screen.
Perform mutations on item in a closure
if the current screen orientation has changed.
Text mask for masks based on arbitrary text.
Any type that primarily acts as a “container” (i.e.
as opposed to a “functional type).
Any Isocsceles Trapezoid which is a quadrilateral with
one pair of parallel sides with the other sides “projecting”
inward or outward at equivalent angles. For “acute”,
“obtuse” or other less regular types, use CloseSidedShape.
Protocol for any view or layer that is intended to
be used as a container for scroll view content
and that can be resized and have that resize
bubble up to it’s container scroll view’s “contentSize”.
See convenience class ContentView and ContentLayer
which conform to this.
Any item that can be used as a reference for positioning
and sizing other items.
See also Queryable – the super-set of Referential.
CancelButton supports canceling and dismissing a related
ancestor Presentable if initialized with “dismissive”.
Adhoc actions can be attached to this button or via
delegate using Mutator event API.
This button is automatically “control state updatable”
for theme changes on the button itself and potentially on a
ControlBackground (layer) if it exists.
(This also presumes the button or super type (e.g. UIView)
conforms to ThemeAccessible or ThemeOverridable.)
This button supports optionally constructing with data on
attachment (i.e. via in(..data:) method). The data type to
provide is a tuple of button text, optional button outset,
and whether or not to add a control background.
(You may create multiple buttons this way by providing
multiple data tuples as normal with ConstructibleWithData.)
Passing a theme to in() is optional but preferred (the theme
will be applied to the button as well as the background).
The default background type is ControlBackground but you may
also use a custom subclass of ControlBackground by subclassing
the button class and assigning the new background type to the
typealias UpdatableBackground. Example:
class MyButton : CancelButton { typealias UpdatableBackground = MyBackground }
If you pass a theme that inherits from the built-in theme
(via Theme.getBuiltInTheme()) then this button and it’s
background will inherit the default styling.
(If you want the background to receive the default styling
your Theme must also statically conform to ExtendedStyleAccessible
with the static property ExtendedStyleDefaults, with
usesButtonBackgroundLayers set to true.)
If you choose to use this initializer but do not want the
background to appear at all you may either hide it manually:
e.g. .with { $0.backgrounds }.hide()
or create a style in your theme to hide it:
e.g. MyCancelButton.self > Background.self => .contentAlpha(0.0)
CAVEAT: If you want to use a custom Model type (not the one
that is already on ControlButton) you cannot use this class due to
generics limitations. Use DismissableButton or Button instead with
ControlStateCombinedUpdatable as necessary. You will also
probably want to conform to DismissableButtonConfigurable
to get the tap action to dismiss.
See also CancelButton2 that supports Shape backgrounds.
Retrieve the containing data store object
from the ancestor container of provided type.
Perform mutations in trailing closure whenever data is relayed
from previous/ancestor of provided type that is within the current
hierarchy assuming the previous/ancestor item(s) have a data model
and have created a relay pass-through publisher that relays that
data model on updates.
Columns is a Grid representing a portion of the layout
which is evenly subdivided into columns (cells).
These columns can be further grouped using Quadrants or
iterated via Query.iterateCells/Columns().
Class to use when creating non-custom type system buttons
such as “infoDark”, “contactAdd” etc.
A Background (in every other sense) that is also dependent
on ancestor’s control state for the purpose of styling.
Protocol for any object that is taggable.
A tag is an adhoc string like a CSS “class” that can
be used for identification, grouping, styling, etc.
Perform mutations on item in a closure if
the containing ContextView size has been updated
on size class change or orientation change
Star shape with arbitrary number of points,
point sharpness, and pivot (sits on 1 or 2 points).
Explicit size provided via span or implicitly
based on container.
Adhoc shape with array of absolute points (straight lines)
or array of bezier points (straight or curved lines).
A fixed ratio shape based on arbitrary text (and font)
converted to a path, with aspect ratio being maintained
when sized.
Supports absolute sizing on either (but not both) axes
or implicit sizing relative to either (but not both)
axes of the container item, with optional adjustment.
Perform new item creations on queried parent item
in a closure if parent item has not been displayed
on the screen) or, when the orientation has changed,
or size class has changed, or color scheme has changed.
A layer representing a background.
Prefer using Background or BackgroundView over applying
adhoc background changes to container views.
See also SnapshotBackground for use in lists.
Backgrounds are generally the “first sibling” to whatever
it is providing a background for and would rarely have
children (except for custom backgrounds).
Backgrounds have a specific construction, for example:
Where parent is a layer, the background is sent to back,
it is stretched to fit it’s parent (or including “outset”
if specified on creation), it masks content to it’s bounds
(unless overridden) and it inherits ancestor corner radius.
When Background is used in conjunction with “in()”,
a focussed API is provided to background mutations,
include full Theme support.
For more complex Backgrounds, including multilayer
Backgrounds and layering effects, use make{} or build{}
on the Background instance to add hierarchy,
or use the convenience API add{} and addLayer{}.
Perform item creations on parent item in a closure
if parent item is currently displayed on the screen
and this is not a required update (e.g. orientation change).
Rows is a Grid representing a portion of the layout
which is evenly subdivided into rows (cells).
These rows can be further grouped using Quadrants or
iterated via Query.iterateCells/Rows().
Any Parallelogram having four sides with opposite
parallel sides slanted one way or the other based
on provided “slant” which is a positive or negative
relative value on the side being slanted.
Presentable dialog view that provides a backdrop
and default vertical stack view.
See also Alert which wraps Dialog and simplifies
presenting an alert.
NOTE: as with all StackViews this type uses autolayout
exclusively for it’s arranged views. If the intent is
to use elements that do not work well with autolayout
then consider creating a custom view instead.
Shape representing a single or multiple segment line
(an “open” shape) with straight or curved segments
using
points within a sized container.
Lines default to being “flat” which prevents fill or
stroke from being auto-expanded via layer Addons.
See also OpenShape which behaves similar to Line
except it is NOT “flat” by default, thereby
supporting all Addons.
Horizontal oval shape with a fixed ratio providing
a classic oval which is elongated similar in shape
to an egg. Provide arbitrary “span” for the width
or “edge” to size implicitly to edge of parent.
Presentable alert view that provides a backdrop,
default vertical stack view, and the basic structure
of an alert including label, text, cancel and confirm
buttons. Use the trailing API to modify these, including
adding a background.
See also the more general Dialog class.
Perform mutations in trailing closure whenever data is relayed
from previous/ancestor of provided type that is within the current
hierarchy assuming the previous/ancestor item(s) have a data model
and have created a relay pass-through publisher that relays that
data model on updates.
Any item that can be owned by a view
Alias view that represents the foreground
view within a masked hierarchy.
A shape comprised of arbitrary open and closed paths
using points of type CGPoint, BezierPoint, Position
or Quadrantal, or combinations thereof.
Diamond shape of arbitrary size on either axis or
implicitly sized to parent on either or both axes.
Shape is constructed by making 4 points at the
middle of each side.
SpriteKit node for images or solid colors
Basic wrapper to UIControl, supporting control state updates.
See also CustomControl protocol which also supports layers
and guides, in addition to views; and may avoid side-effects
related to using a UIControl in some cases.
Shape mask for non-rectangular masks.
Perform mutations in trailing closure whenever data is relayed
from queried item(s) within the current hierarchy as provided
assuming those items have a data model and have created a relay
pass-through publisher that relays that data model on updates.
Auto-created layer for use with advanced reference alignments.
Text view configured for text editing.
(this is the default configuration for a UITextView)
See also DisplayText that is configured for display.
Special embedded view type that is returned
from Mutator.sizeToFitAndMask() that contains
an ImageMask (and image).
This type is not meant to be instantiated
outside of the sizeToFitAndMask() API.
Any type that can exist in SwiftUI.
This is used for optimizations depending
on if the item is within or without
a SwiftUI hierarchy.
Perform action on item whenever the item’s containing UIScene
will be remove from the app.
Perform new item creations on parent item in
a closure if parent item has not yet been displayed
on the screen or, when the orientation has changed,
or size class has changed, or color scheme has changed.
Regardless, this method returns new items just created
or already existing.
Perform mutations on item in a closure if item
is currently displayed on the screen and this is
not a required update (e.g. orientation change).
On update (item currently displayed on screen),
perform mutations in a closure and return item
to allow performing further mutations afterward
regardless, or do not return item to prevent
subsequent mutations. On create, item will
be affected by subsequent operations regardless.
ControlButton2 is kind of button that is automatically
“control state updatable” for theme changes on the button
itself and potentially on a background Shape if it exists.
(This also presumes the button or super type (e.g. UIView)
conforms to ThemeAccessible or ThemeOverridable.)
This button is also Dismissable if “dismissive” is passed.
This button supports constructing with data on attachment
(i.e. via in(..data:) method). The data type to provide
is a tuple of button text, optional button outset,
and optional corner spec. Using this approach will cause a
rectangular shape background (that is also control state
updatable) to be added. (The rectangle will obtain corner
spec if provided.) Passing a theme to in() is optional
but preferred (the theme will be applied to the button
as well as the shape).
(You may create multiple buttons this way by providing
multiple data tuples as per normal with ConstructibleWithData.)
If you prefer to use your own custom shape for this button
then do not use the construct-with-data approach or alternatively,
override the construct(data:) method. But keep in mind that
your custom shape should pass “updatable:true” to ensure
it can participate in control state updates.
If you pass a theme that inherits from the built-in theme
(via Theme.getBuiltInTheme()) then this button and it’s
background will inherit the default styling.
(If you want the background to receive the default styling
your Theme must also statically conform to ExtendedStyleAccessible
with the static property ExtendedStyleDefaults, with
usesButtonBackgroundLayers set to true.)
If you choose to use this initializer but do not want the
background to appear at all you may either hide it manually:
e.g. .with { $0.shapes }.hide()
or create a style in your theme to hide it:
e.g. MyControlButton.self > Shape.self => .contentAlpha(0.0)
CAVEAT: If you want to use a custom Model type (not the one
that is already on ControlButton2) you cannot use this class due to
generics limitations. Use DismissableButton or Button instead with
ControlStateCombinedUpdatable as necessary.
See also ControlButton that supports regular layer backgrounds.
Autolayout guide used to denote a fixed-size or flexible
space between two items on an axis (or axes). Provide
Size to make this a fixed size Spacer. This class is
“abstract”. Use one of the “concrete” subclasses to rep-
resent inner (sibling) and outer (container) spacers.
This class is ABSTRACT. Use the concrete types instead.
A layer that has been dynamically embedded between
and layer and its parent layer.
Make items in trailing closure (potentially with data)
whenever provided publisher emits new elements.
Circle shape of provided diameter or
implicitly sized based on container.
An optional starting angle can be used
to start the path arc at a specific point
moving clockwise to the end point.
This is useful when modifying the
strokeStart/strokeEnd of a path which
should begin/end relative to a specific
point on the circle (e.g. with circular
progress indicators).
Perform new item creations on parent item in
a closure if parent item has not yet been displayed
on the screen. Regardless, this method returns new
items just created or already existing.
Quadrilateral shape of arbitrary width/height or
implicitly sized to fill container.
This is different than Rectangle in 2 ways:
Alias view that masks the “live view” in
in a masked hierarchy.
Used with Mutator.embedMaskedView().
ControlButton is kind of button that is automatically
“control state updatable” for theme changes on the button
itself and potentially on a ControlBackground (layer) if it exists.
(This also presumes the button or super type (e.g. UIView)
conforms to ThemeAccessible or ThemeOverridable.)
This button is also Dismissable if “dismissive” is passed.
This button supports optionally constructing with data on
attachment (i.e. via in(..data:) method). The data type to
provide is a tuple of button text, optional button outset,
and whether or not to add a control background.
(You may create multiple buttons this way by providing
multiple data tuples as normal with ConstructibleWithData.)
Passing a theme to in() is optional but preferred (the theme
will be applied to the button as well as the background).
The default background type is ControlBackground but you may
also use a custom subclass of ControlBackground by subclassing
the button class and assigning the new background type to the
typealias UpdatableBackground. Example:
class MyButton : ConfirmButton { typealias UpdatableBackground = MyBackground }
If you pass a theme that inherits from the built-in theme
(via Theme.getBuiltInTheme()) then this button and it’s
background will inherit the default styling.
(If you want the background to receive the default styling
your Theme must also statically conform to ExtendedStyleAccessible
with the static property ExtendedStyleDefaults, with
usesButtonBackgroundLayers set to true.)
If you choose to use this initializer but do not want the
background to appear at all you may either hide it manually:
e.g. .with { $0.backgrounds }.hide()
or create a style in your theme to hide it:
e.g. MyControlButton.self > Background.self => .contentAlpha(0.0)
CAVEAT: If you want to use a custom Model type (not the one
that is already on ControlButton) you cannot use this class due to
generics limitations. Use DismissableButton or Button instead with
ControlStateCombinedUpdatable as necessary.
See also ControlButton2 that supports Shape based backgrounds.
ConfirmButton2 supports firing attached actions and handles
dismissing any related ancestor Presentable if initialized
with “dismissive”.
Adhoc actions can be attached to this button or via
delegate using Mutator event API.
This button is automatically “control state updatable” for
theme changes on the button itself and potentially on a
background Shape if it exists.
(This also presumes the button or super type (e.g. UIView)
conforms to ThemeAccessible or ThemeOverridable.)
This button is also Dismissable if “dismissive” is passed.
This button supports constructing with data on attachment
(i.e. via in(..data:) method). The data type to provide
is a tuple of button text, optional button outset,
and optional corner spec. Using this approach will cause a
rectangular shape background (that is also control state
updatable) to be added. (The rectangle will obtain corner
spec if provided.) Passing a theme to in() is optional
but preferred (the theme will be applied to the button
as well as the shape).
(You may create multiple buttons this way by providing
multiple data tuples as per normal with ConstructibleWithData.)
If you prefer to use your own custom shape for this button
then do not use the construct-with-data approach or alternatively,
override the construct(data:) method. But keep in mind that
your custom shape should pass “updatable:true” to ensure
it can participate in control state updates.
If you pass a theme that inherits from the built-in theme
(via Theme.getBuiltInTheme()) then this button and it’s
background will inherit the default styling.
(If you want the background to receive the default styling
your Theme must also statically conform to ExtendedStyleAccessible
with the static property ExtendedStyleDefaults, with
usesButtonBackgroundLayers set to true.)
If you choose to use this initializer but do not want the
background to appear at all you may either hide it manually:
e.g. .with { $0.shapes }.hide()
or create a style in your theme to hide it:
e.g. MyConfirmButton.self > Shape.self => .contentAlpha(0.0)
CAVEAT: If you want to use a custom Model type (not the one
that is already on ControlButton2) you cannot use this class due to
generics limitations. Use DismissableButton or Button instead with
ControlStateCombinedUpdatable as necessary.
See also ConfirmButton that supports regular layer backgrounds.
Exclusive buttons support exclusive selection state
within a group of sibling Exclusive buttons.
(Similar to a “radio group” in web programming,
and functionally similar to UISegmentedControl.)
ExclusiveControlButton is automatically “control state
updatable” for theme changes on the button itself and
potentially on a ControlBackground (layer) if it exists.
(This also presumes the button or super type (e.g. UIView)
conforms to ThemeAccessible or ThemeOverridable.)
Any closed shape with straight or curved lines
using relative points (positions or quadrantals).
Supports absolute sizing or implicit sizing to parent
on either or both axes, with optional adjustment.
For straight lined shapes with rounded corners or smoothing
use CloseSidedShape instead.
Elliptical shape of arbitrary width/height or
implicitly sized to container. See also Oval
if you want the classic oval ratio.
Perform item creations on parent item in a closure
if parent item is currently displayed on the screen.
Exclusive buttons support exclusive selection state
within a group of sibling Exclusive buttons.
(Similar to a “radio group” in web programming,
and functionally similar to UISegmentedControl.)
ExclusiveControlButton2 is automatically “control state
updatable” for theme changes on the button itself and
potentially on a background Shape if it exists.
(This also presumes the button or super type (e.g. UIView)
conforms to ThemeAccessible or ThemeOverridable.)
Perform mutations on item in a closure if
item has not yet been displayed on the screen.
Perform mutations on item in a closure
on creation or if the current device has not
changed orientation for the current update.
Alias shape layer that represents the foreground
shape within a masked hierarchy.
Arc shape of provided diameter or
implicitly sized based on container.
An optional starting angle can be used
to start the path arc at a specific point
moving clockwise to the end angle.
The default start angle is 0.0 (right side
of circle) and end angle is 180.0 (left side
of circle) moving clockwise.
This type is useful when modifying the
strokeStart/strokeEnd of a path which
should begin/end relative to a specific
point on the circle (e.g. with circular
progress indicators).
An Overlay is a simple layer with a tint
(e.g. transparent black/white) that is stretched
to fit over top of the parent it is added to.
This is class is Presentable with a default prepare()
method that sets the view alpha to 0.0.
To make this visible (alpha 1.0) call present()
(which can be animated or not).
Perform new item creations on parent item in
a closure if parent item has not yet been displayed
on the screen. Regardless, this method returns new
items just created or already existing.
Perform mutations on item in a closure if item
is currently displayed on the screen.
Any
shape with straight or curved lines
using relative points (positions or quadrantals).
Supports absolute sizing or implicit sizing to parent
on either or both axes, with optional adjustment.
For straight lined shapes with rounded corners or smoothing
use OpenSidedShape instead. See also Line w/other initialization
options. Very similar to this except Line is “flat” by default.
Capsule shape of arbitrary width/height or implicitly
sized on either or both axes of the parent item.
A “capsule” is a rectangle where the shortest side
is rounded so that it looks like a capsule (aka “pill-shape”
or like a “race track”).
Proxy class for embedding typographic items while retaining
the Typographical interface. Use this with embed methods.
Perform action on item whenever the item’s containing UIScene
will resign the active state and stop responding to events.
Semantic class for the container content layer of a scroll view.
This class should be the direct child of the scroll view
with any “content” existing in this container layer.
Hexagon with 6 sides.
Explicit size provided via span or implicitly
based on container.
Octagon with 8 sides.
Explicit size provided via span or implicitly
based on container.
Perform mutations on item in a closure
if the context view is sized to fill the screen.
Grid represents a portion of the layout which is
evenly subdivided into columns and rows (cells).
Provide the matrix (cols/rows) on initialization
then add child “Quadrants” to define which portion
of the grid to “snap to”. Within those quadrants
add whatever UI you need.
Perform new item creations on parent item in
a closure if parent item has not yet been displayed
on the screen. Regardless, this method returns new
items just created or already existing.
Anything that can be added to a parent/child hierarchy.
Embed current item in parent “embed” view and
act on that parent “embed” view in provided closure
if the current item has not yet been displayed on
screen (i.e. is being created), and return the parent
“embed” view from this method regardless (i.e. on
creation and on update).
Wrapper C3UI view for injecting arbitrary SwiftUI code
into a C3UI hierarchy.
Embed current layer in parent “embed” layer and
act on that parent “embed” layer in provided closure
if the current layer has not yet been displayed on
screen (i.e. is being created), and return the parent
“embed” layer from this method regardless (i.e. on
creation and on update).
Any object that can access the environment
Any item that can have a “container view”
The only difference between this and ViewAssociable
is that views return superview with this and
self with ViewAssociable. Other conformances
are the same.
Flag to indicate an object is internal-only
and should therefore be excluded from queries.
This is marked “public” visibility so that it
can be part of Queryable (via MetaCodable) and
therefore eliminate (expensive) protocol casting.
On creation or if the current device has not
changed orientation for the current update,
perform mutations in a closure and return item
to allow performing further mutations afterward
regardless, or do not return item to prevent
subsequent mutations.
On update or orientation change, item will be
affected by subsequent operations regardless.
Alias view that represents the “live content”
that is masked within a masked hierarchy.
Perform mutations on item in a closure if item
has not been displayed on the screen or, when the
orientation has changed, or size class has changed,
or color scheme has changed.
A BackgroundView (in every other sense) that is also dependent
on ancestor’s control state for the purpose of styling.
Perform mutations on item in a closure if
the containing ContextView color scheme has been
including dark/light mode or accessibility contrast.
Container node that is sizable and positionable.
NOTE! Pinning/stretching operations are not implemented
yet in order to work with SpriteKit’s reverse Y axis.
Layer used for coordinate space conversions
for layout guides and identification within
the layer hierarchy.
Shape representing a single or multiple segment line
(an “open” shape) with straight or curved using
points within a sized container.
Lines default to being “flat” which prevents fill or
stroke from being auto-expanded via layer Addons.
See also AdhocShape which behaves similar to AdhocLine
except it is NOT “flat” by default, thereby supporting
all Addons.
A protocol that provides an efficient low-level
interface to work with super/sub-items, non-recursively.
Right triangle is a triangle that has one 90º angle,
such that it originates from any corner of a square.
Of the three points that make up the triangle, the
first point starts at the corner and the other two
points are clockwise from that.
Basic SpriteKit node.
The explicit backing layer of all C3 view types.
Flag protocol used by ContextView (and HostingView)
to track trait changes and ephemeral values.
Injected hosting view to a C3 hierarchy that
exists within a SwiftUI hierarchy.
Perform mutations on item in a closure
if the current device is of a specific idiom
(or one of provided idioms).
Spacer that provides space between the trailing/bottom
edge of a container and it’s last item.
Perform mutations on item in a closure
if the current screen is in landscape orientation.
CancelButton2 supports canceling and dismissing a related
ancestor Presentable if initialized with “dismissive”.
Adhoc actions can be attached to this button or via
delegate using Mutator event API.
This button is automatically “control state updatable” for
theme changes on the button itself and potentially on a
background Shape if it exists.
(This also presumes the button or super type (e.g. UIView)
conforms to ThemeAccessible or ThemeOverridable.)
This button is also Dismissable if “dismissive” is passed.
This button supports constructing with data on attachment
(i.e. via in(..data:) method). The data type to provide
is a tuple of button text, optional button outset,
and optional corner spec. Using this approach will cause a
rectangular shape background (that is also control state
updatable) to be added. (The rectangle will obtain corner
spec if provided.) Passing a theme to in() is optional
but preferred (the theme will be applied to the button
as well as the shape).
(You may create multiple buttons this way by providing
multiple data tuples as per normal with ConstructibleWithData.)
If you prefer to use your own custom shape for this button
then do not use the construct-with-data approach or alternatively,
override the construct(data:) method. But keep in mind that
your custom shape should pass “updatable:true” to ensure
it can participate in control state updates.
If you pass a theme that inherits from the built-in theme
(via Theme.getBuiltInTheme()) then this button and it’s
background will inherit the default styling.
(If you want the background to receive the default styling
your Theme must also statically conform to ExtendedStyleAccessible
with the static property ExtendedStyleDefaults, with
usesButtonBackgroundLayers set to true.)
If you choose to use this initializer but do not want the
background to appear at all you may either hide it manually:
e.g. .with { $0.shapes }.hide()
or create a style in your theme to hide it:
e.g. MyCancelButton.self > Shape.self => .contentAlpha(0.0)
CAVEAT: If you want to use a custom Model type (not the one
that is already on ControlButton2) you cannot use this class due to
generics limitations. Use DismissableButton or Button instead with
ControlStateCombinedUpdatable as necessary. You will also
probably want to conform to DismissableButtonConfigurable
to get the tap action to dismiss.
See also CancelButton that supports regular layer backgrounds.
Any
shape with straight lines, arbitrary side
lengths/angles specified using relative points.
Supports absolute sizing or implicit sizing to parent
on either or both axes, with optional adjustment.
Supports rounded corners or smoothing.
For open shapes with bezier curves use OpenShape.
Semantic class for the container content view of a scroll view.
This class should be the direct child of the scroll view
with any “content” existing in this container view.
Simple Square shape with arbitrary size as
span (width and height) or conforming to edge
of container maintaining 1:1 ratio.
Perform action on item whenever the item’s containing UIScene
will enter the foreground.
Rectangle shape of arbitrary width/height or
implicitly sized to fill container.
Optionally provide corner radius and specify
which corners are rounded. If corner radius
not specified and corners is other than []
this will attempt to obtain the corner radius
from the container.
A view representing a background than can use autolayout constraints.
Prefer using Background or BackgroundView over applying
adhoc background changes to container views.
See also SnapshotBackground for use in lists.
Backgrounds are generally the “first sibling” to whatever
it is providing a background for and would rarely have
children (except for custom backgrounds).
BackgroundViews have a specific construction, for example:
Where parent is a view, the item is sent to back,
user interaction is turned off, it is stretched to
fit it’s parent (or including “outset” if specified
on creation), it masks content to it’s bounds
(unless overriden), it provides appropriate autolayout
constraints and it inherits ancestor corner radius.
Further, when used in conjunction with “in()” it
provides a focussed API to background mutations,
include full Theme support.
For more complex Backgrounds, including multilayer
Backgrounds and layering effects, use make{} or build{}
on the Background instance to add hierarchy,
or use the convenience API add{} and addLayer{}.
Perform mutations on item in a closure
if the current screen is in portrait orientation.
Any item/hierarchy that requires independent construction
beyond basic layout code, requires a data model to
determine it’s presentation, and must have that construction
continuously updated via a declarative interface.
A protocol specialization on protocols that store
specific pieces of meta data, with the default
storage on layers via KVC.
Protocol for any object that is identifiable
and can be queried by identifier.
Any view or layer type that can be shallow copied.
Switchable buttons support toggling the selected state
of the button. Check selected state via “isSelected”.
(Similar to UISwitch or a “check box” in web programming.)
SwitchableControlButton is automatically “control state
updatable” for theme changes on the button itself and
potentially on a ControlBackground (layer) if it exists.
(This also presumes the button or super type (e.g. UIView)
conforms to ThemeAccessible or ThemeOverridable.)
Perform mutations in trailing closure whenever data is relayed
from queried item(s) within the current hierarchy as provided
assuming those items have a data model and have created a relay
pass-through publisher that relays that data model on updates.
Equilateral triangle is a triangle of equal side lengths and
interior angles (60º). It is a fixed ratio shape ->
1.0 (base) : 1.167 (length) (vertex to opposite corner).
Heptagon with 7 sides.
Explicit size provided via span or implicitly
based on container.
Perform mutations on item in a closure if
a value is true. Optionally, provide an
block to perform mutations on item in a
closure if value is false.
Exclusive buttons support exclusive selection state
within a group of sibling Exclusive buttons.
(Similar to a “radio group” in web programming,
and functionally similar to UISegmentedControl.)
To ensure independent handling of separate groups
make sure each group is within it’s own parent view
or, at a minimum, layout guide.
Switchable buttons support toggling the selected state
of the button. Check selected state via “isSelected”.
(Similar to UISwitch or a “check box” in web programming.)
SwitchableControlButton2 is automatically “control state
updatable” for theme changes on the button itself and
potentially on a background Shape if it exists.
(This also presumes the button or super type (e.g. UIView)
conforms to ThemeAccessible or ThemeOverridable.)
DisableOverlay is a simple view with a tint
(e.g. transparent black/white) that is stretched
to fit over top of the parent it is added to.
User interaction is disabled.
This is class is Presentable with a default prepare()
method that sets the view alpha to 0.0.
To make this visible (alpha 1.0) call present()
(which can be animated or not).
See also Backdrop which goes behind views.
Perform action on item whenever the item’s containing UIScene
has entered the background.
Any polygonal shape with straight lines, arbitrary side
lengths/angles specified using relative points.
Supports absolute sizing or implicit sizing to parent
on either or both axes, with optional adjustment.
Supports rounded corners or smoothing.
For shapes with bezier curves use ClosedShape
instead which supports curved lines.
For a true symmetric polygon, use Polygon and derivitives.
Specialized top-level view for use with ViewController
or as HostingView (superview) within SwiftUI.
For ViewController based setup provide this class
in InterfaceBuilder for the controller’s view.
In all other cases, do not use this class.
Use BaseView (or derivitive) instead.
DismissableButton is a button that can indirectly control
whether or not Presentable ancestor items dismiss (including
firing related actions).
Specify “dismissive” on initialization to get this behavior.
Any fixed ratio shape provided from a complete path,
with aspect ratio being maintained when sized. (Use
AnyFlexibleShape for sizing that ignores aspect ratio.)
Supports absolute sizing on either (but not both) axes
or implicit sizing relative to either (but not both)
axes of the container item, with optional adjustment.
SpriteKit view for containing scenes and nodes.
A view that has been dynamically embedded between
and view and its parent view.
ConfirmButton supports firing attached actions and handles
dismissing any related ancestor Presentable if initialized
with “dismissive”.
Adhoc actions can be attached to this button or via
delegate using Mutator event API.
This button is automatically “control state updatable”
for theme changes on the button itself and potentially on a
ControlBackground (layer) if it exists.
(This also presumes the button or super type (e.g. UIView)
conforms to ThemeAccessible or ThemeOverridable.)
This button supports optionally constructing with data on
attachment (i.e. via in(..data:) method). The data type to
provide is a tuple of button text, optional button outset,
and whether or not to add a control background.
(You may create multiple buttons this way by providing
multiple data tuples as normal with ConstructibleWithData.)
Passing a theme to in() is optional but preferred (the theme
will be applied to the button as well as the background).
The default background type is ControlBackground but you may
also use a custom subclass of ControlBackground by subclassing
the button class and assigning the new background type to the
typealias UpdatableBackground. Example:
class MyButton : ConfirmButton { typealias UpdatableBackground = MyBackground }
If you pass a theme that inherits from the built-in theme
(via Theme.getBuiltInTheme()) then this button and it’s
background will inherit the default styling.
(If you want the background to receive the default styling
your Theme must also statically conform to ExtendedStyleAccessible
with the static property ExtendedStyleDefaults, with
usesButtonBackgroundLayers set to true.)
If you choose to use this initializer but do not want the
background to appear at all you may either hide it manually:
e.g. .with { $0.backgrounds }.hide()
or create a style in your theme to hide it:
e.g. MyControlButton.self > Background.self => .contentAlpha(0.0)
CAVEAT: If you want to use a custom Model type (not the one
that is already on ControlButton) you cannot use this class due to
generics limitations. Use DismissableButton or Button instead with
ControlStateCombinedUpdatable as necessary.
See also CancelButton2 that supports Shape backgrounds.
Wrapper to create and store an underlying view snapshot.
Any item/hierarchy that requires independent construction
beyond basic layout code, and must have that construction
continuously updated via a declarative interface.
Perform action on item whenever the item’s containing UIScene
has entered the foreground.
Triangle represents an Isosceles triangle specified with a base edge
and two equal side lengths and two equal angles, OR it could represent
a custom triangle using relative points (Scalene, Acute, etc).
Pentagon with 5 sides.
Explicit size provided via span or implicitly
based on container.
Perform mutations on item in a closure if
the containing ContextView size class has been updated.
Items that can have parent guides.
Any coordinate space that can be converted to another.
Perform mutations on item in a closure
if the current device orientation has changed.
A layout area with a fixed area and optional insets.
Types that conform to this are basically “containers”.
Special text layer class that supports
vertically aligned text.
CAVEAT: Support for layer addons (gradients,
tiles, shadows) may not work as expected.
If you don’t absolutely need vertical alignment
prefer TextLayer instead which is more reliable.
Any Kite shape having four sides of which there are
two exclusive pairs of sides (usually top and bottom)
of equal length, with kite originating from base
edge (default bottom) and relative shift value from
center of perpendicular axis.
Polygon shape with arbitrary number of sides,
and “pivotal” option to rest on 1 or 2 points.
Explicit size provided via span or implicitly
based on container. This is a “polygon” in the
common sense where sides and angles are evenly
distributed around the circumference. Officially,
however, a polygon is any plane figure with straight
lines – even if irregular. See also CloseSidedShape
which supports any type of polygonal shape.
Label representing caption text for some other item.
It’s not normally necessary to instantiate this – it
is done for you via Mutator.createCaption() API.
(however you can use the type for query/filtering)
Text view configured for static text display.
Text views default to fill available space within the parent.
See also EditableText.
The protocol composition that views, layers, guides and nodes
conform to on all generic wrappers, such as Query, Mutator and others.
Any flexibly sized shape provided from a complete path.
Aspect ratio is NOT maintained when sized.
(Use AnyShape to maintain aspect ratio.)
Supports absolute sizing or implicit sizing to parent
on either or both axes, with optional adjustment.
Anything that can have an explicitly defined index.
Perform new item creations on parent item in
a closure if parent item has not yet been displayed
on the screen or, when the orientation has changed,
or size class has changed, or color scheme has changed.
Regardless, this method returns new items just created
or already existing.
Alias text layer that represents the foreground
text layer within a masked hierarchy.
Special embedded view type that masks a portion
of an image when used in conjunction with
Mutator.sizeToFitAndMask().
This type is not meant to be instantiated
outside of the sizeToFitAndMask() API.
Alias layer that represents the foreground
layer within a masked hierarchy.
Retrieve the data store object via queried store container.
In addition to the functionality of
, this protocol
can be used to override the area definition of existing definable
areas (View, etc) by using a property (variable or computed)
— as opposed to defining it on initialization, or for your own
custom definable areas which may be constructed by calling
from your
or
method.
An orderable object denoted by an integer index.
Perform mutations on item in a closure at the beginning
of the next runloop via small async delay
item has
not been displayed on the screen, or on orientation change,
or size class change, or color scheme change.
On update (item is currently displayed on screen),
allow further operations after this operator if the
provided condition is true, but always on creation.
Example:
Class representing a matrix of tiles spread evenly
within a containing layer or shape, providing
optional number of tiles, offset between tiles,
tile size and a visitor closure with which to
decorate the tiles. Provide “variations” to get
an index given to closure to determine how to decorate.
This class is not intended for public use (though
you can if you want). Use the Mutator.tile* API.
e.g. myView.mutate.tiles(number:[5,4]) { mutator, index in .. }
Standard layer mask container.
The remainder of a layout area. I.e. Total area - fixed area = remainder.
Backdrop is a view that is stretched to fill the parent.
How it is styled is up to the implementor.
See also C3.Defaults.backdropShade which supports a
default backdrop shade.
Technically it’s a button which is initially disabled
from user interaction, unless you choose to allow
interaction via BackdropDelegate (for example if
tapping is to be used to dismiss something).
This is publicly creatable but private for editing.
SpriteKit scene that automatically sizes to its parent view
An item that can store its latest view context
in order to have up-to-date information.
This information is usually transient and
doesn’t persist very long in the stack.
(i.e. not usually later than when the parent
scope exits.)
Spacer that provides space between two sibling items.
Spacer that provides space between the leading/top
edge of a container and it’s first item.
Perform mutations on item in trailing closure
whenever the provided publisher emits new items.
Any item that has a frame with readable information.
SpriteKit node that emits particles.
Perform action on item whenever the item’s containing UIScene
will become connected to the app.
Switchable buttons support toggling the selected state
of the button. Check selected state via “isSelected”.
(Similar to UISwitch or a “check box” in web programming.)
On creation or some required update (e.g. if
the orientation has changed, or size class has
changed or color scheme has changed), perform
mutations in a closure and return item to allow
performing further mutations afterward regardless,
or do not return item to prevent subsequent mutations.
On create, item will be affected by subsequent
operations regardless.
